text: 'Simplified menu with all the traditional favorites. Good food
column5: great frozen margaritas and good service. Disappointed however they feel they need to automatically charge 20% gratuity. I do not feel a $13 drink ordered necessarily should cost $14.60. Or that the public is not capable of tipping accordingly. Should gratuity automatically start at 20%? What happened to 15 and 18%? These servers are making $60 per hour+ for serving Mexican style McDonalds. I have a college degree and don‚Äôt make half that. 2 ppl X 2 taco orders X 2 frozen margaritas + tip = $60.38'

author: Daniel Sakuta
text: 'This place is a solid establishment. It was my first time by my friends had been many. They were busy but everyone worked diligently to get us seated quickly
column5: food runners brought chips and water before the waitress (who has worked here for a long time) could even take our order. Even after that
column6: two different food runners and the waitress came frequently to bring more chips and salsa and check if we needed anything. I‚Äôm big on customer service from so many bad experiences going places where people are literally just hanging out
column7:
are doing whatever on their phones and give you nasty attitude despite trying to set a friendly tone as a customer but they really bring their A game here. Everyone was really friendly and upbeat despite the hectic pace of the business that night.

Also everyone was super happy with their food and drinks were on point.

10/10 would recommend and go back.'

'One of the most amazing margaritas and quesadillas. The servers are really friendly and ambient.
Happy place and good vibes even in the mid week too. The cost of the food is very reasonable. Delicious food for a good price.

Definitely a thumbs up for this place.

I didn‚Äôt give it 5 stars because of the tacos. For a place like this with everything so good

text: 'I‚Äôll start on a high note: the staff was really
column5: really nice and accommodating.\n\nBut this is not like East LA
column6: or any part of LA
column7: or California in general. If you‚Äôre a Californian
column8: you will be disappointed. The salsa that they gave us with chips was really good
column9: which gave us hope when we sat down. I ordered a chicken enchilada and beef taco. They gave me a chicken taco instead with what tasted like enchilada sauce on it. Tore through the corn tortilla. The enchilada wasn‚Äôt great either. I will continue my search for great as-close-to-LA-as-possible Mexican food elsewhere.'

author: Silvia Sarceno (Like Home Pet Care)
text: 'I love this place and the one star is for the food
column5: margaritas
column6: and the waiters although they deserve a 5star. The reason I am giving this place a 1 star is because of the manager Ryan. Ryan was extremely rude and a complete misrepresentation of what this place used to be. The owners of this establishment need to rehire who they put in charge. Ryan first and foremost shoved a member of our party‚Äôs chair in to ‚Äúmake space‚Äù instead of asking him to slide over. He also began to rush us out our table upon receiving our food asking if we needed to-go boxes while still having the food still in our mouth and it only being the appetizers. He then claimed it was because members of our party ordered food after other members and they had an hour wait. Our party was still eating
column7: still wanted to order entrees and drinks and I don‚Äôt understand how an hour wait has to do with what we wanted to order and how much more we were about to spend. My family and I have been coming to this place since it opened and have never been treated in such an unprofessional manner. Ryan should not be in a position of authority
column8: it is clear as a fellow business owner that he can not access a situation

author: H
text: 'My friend and I faced some major discrimination at this place. We rolled up on our bikes on a Saturday night
column5: and parked them inside the gate. The bouncer asked us to move them outside that area
column6: so we did. On our way to doing so
column7: he said ‚ÄúActually
column8: you can take your business elsewhere.‚Äù  He said this loudly in front of several other patrons. It was really humiliating and hurtful. We did nothing wrong.\n\nI can only assume that he didn‚Äôt want us inside because we didn‚Äôt look like typical Hoboken bros/yuppies/young professionals (though we both have respectable jobs and degrees
column9: not that those things should matter).\n\nI used to grab a burrito from this place every week after an appointment in Hoboken. Never going there again after this incident.'

author: Joshua De Leon
text: "East LA is a Mexican food spot that serves good food and if you like Margarita's your gonna love this place.  When I eat here my go-to choices are the Taco Salad
column5: Enchiladas Rojo
column6: and their burger.  You can get chicken
column7: steak
column8: or shrimp on the Taco Salad while the Enchiladas options are beef
column10: and cheese. Now the burger they serve here is a half pound patty with bacon and cheese on a toasty bun LTO on the side with fries. The Enchiladas and Taco Salad come with guacamole and pico de gallo with the Enchiladas having refried beans and rice served with it.  The portions here are big so your definitely getting your money's worth when you eat here.  Let me move onto the Margarita's.  East LA is known for their Margarita's and let me tell you that these Margarita's are no joke.  First off they have a ton of varieties from a frozen strawberry margarita to a jalapeno margarita on the rocks.  The list of flavors are on the back of the menu and they'll let you mix it up.  When I ate there I had BBQ wings for an app (they have a half off appetizers and $9 Margarita's happy hour Mon - Fri 4pm - 7pm) the shrimp Taco Salad as my entree with a mango passion fruit margarita to wash it down."

text: "Friday evenings
column5: East LA has great specials. However
column6: you can't take advantage of any of their bar specials and enjoy the place unless you find a seat at the bar. You have to just stand around the bar when there are empty seats throughout the entire place unless you purchase a entree. If you're just trying to take advantage of the apps and margaritas
column7: you really are going to be annoyed with people pushing you out if the way and not letting you sit down at all."

author: Jason Belz
text: 'Terrible hostess. We were sitting next to a couple who were waiting for their food for a very long time (repeatedly asking where it was and told it was coming in 5 minutes). The patio was full when they arrived and it completely emptied out during their wait for their food. They got fed up waiting and asked to pay for their drinks and just leave. They asked the hostess and she put her hand up and said
column5: ‚ÄòI know you don‚Äôt think I‚Äôm your server. You seem to think I‚Äôm your server
column6: but I‚Äôm not. Do I look like your server?‚Äô What kind of hostess says that when someone has been waiting for their food for an hour and are clearly pissed off? The couple got up and just left without paying. The woman was yelling about the bad review she was going to leave as she walked away. Okay fine. We ate our food
column7: it was fine and our actual server was a nice guy. The tables outside are horrible and constantly wobble. Ours wobbled once and an entire glass of water spilled on me. Fine
column8: it happens. As we were paying the check
column9: the table wobbled again and an entire mango margarita spilled in my lap. A server (not ours) came over and said ‚Äòoh that happens all the time‚Äô to which my husband said ‚Äòthese tables are horrible.‚Äô The waiter said
column11: everybody complains about the tables and drinks spilling
column12: it gets people outta here quicker.‚Äô He even took a glass and showed us how the glasses get caught on the wood slats and fall. A place with good service would offer up a new margarita
column13: not make jokes while my pants are soaking wet and sticky. So we pay the bill
column14: leave and start to get our bike and realize that we left the wrong total on the check because we had a gift card. So my husband went back and asked the hostess if he could make sure the bill was properly filled out to which she said
column15: ‚ÄòI don‚Äôt know I‚Äôm not your server!‚Äô My husband went in to speak with the manager and asked for the name of the hostess. The manager was extremely apologetic and kind
column16: but this place has major problems with service. We have no plan to return.'

author: Gabriel
text: 'A restaurant to walk in have a margarita near the bar and walk out. Bar tenders were great and attentive! The Saturday night dinner service was TERRIBLE! (There was maybe a one table wait
column5: not super busy) After 25 mintues of waiting at a table we finally flagged down Manager Jeff to request our orders be taken because no servers did. Orders now taken
column6: food out
column7: we were told server Jorge M would be assigned to our table. Another 20 minutes went by and neither Jorge M or Manager stopped by to ask if we needed anything. Food is mediocre at best. One plate came out cold! Manager attempted to reconcile but the experience was ruined. Would not recommend it to anyone looking for a restaurant in Hoboken.'

text: 'If I could give this place 0 stars I would. I can not fathom how terrible not only was the service but the food was. I placed 2 orders of tacos that came with rice and beans. The tacos were dry and had little to no flavor

I spoke to the manager several times about the order of rice and beans and they still proceeded to never bring them out. This places does not deserve any stars what so ever.'

text: "I can't fathom how people can praise the food at this restaurant. Service and all is good but it matters only if the food is good. And believe me
